title-group.article-title: On the Sato-Tate Conjecture for QM-Curves of Genus Two

abstract.p: An abelian surface A is called a QM-abelian surface if its endomorphism ring includes an order of an indefinite quaternion algebra, and a curve C of genus two is called a QM-curve if its jacobian variety is a QM-abelian surface. We give a computational result about the distribution of the arguments of the eigenvalues of the Frobenius endomorphisms of QM-abelian surfaces modulo good primes, which supports an analogue of the Sato-Tate Conjecture for such abelian surfaces. We also make some remarks on the field of definition of QM-curves and their endomorphisms.
